name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be

sentences.english: He is poor apology for a paladin.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个徒有虚名的游侠罢了。

sentences.english: This small"demon"not wave get hollow reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这个小“精灵”绝非浪得虚名。

sentences.english: He is a scholar of a kind.
sentences.chinese: 他是个徒有虚名的学者。

sentences.english: Not a false reputation, sarcasm disappear, do more practical work, honor.
sentences.chinese: 不图虚名，讥讽随之消失，多干实事，荣誉不期而至。

sentences.english: Till love and fame to nothingness do sink.
sentences.chinese: 直到爱与虚名化为乌有沉寂无声。

sentences.english: The system monitor chamber is only in name.
sentences.chinese: 体制监察室徒有虚名等。

sentences.english: Mr Green is a professor in name but not in reality.
sentences.chinese: 格林先生是徒有虚名的教授。

sentences.english: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.
sentences.chinese: 不要贪图虚名，彼此惹气，互相嫉妒。

sentences.english: He is a ruler without power, a mere fly on the wheel .
sentences.chinese: 他是一个没有实权的统治者，只是徒有虚名而已。

sentences.english: Reputationisoften got without merit and lost without fault .
sentences.chinese: 浪得虚名寻常见，无过失名亦不鲜。

sentences.english: Where boist'rous joy is but a name.
sentences.chinese: 他们的欢乐不过是虚名。

sentences.english: Rather negative in name transition youth.
This new atmosphere is not lifted shares in circulation as illusory.
sentences.chinese: 这种新气象，并非因为解禁股流通徒有虚名。

definition: with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
